meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I skedded a meeting with my boss.
meanings.sent2: She skedded her appointments for the week on Monday.
meanings.sent3: The cat skedded her nap time right before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The students skedded their study sessions like clockwork.
meanings.sent5: He skedded his workout routine for maximum efficiency.

meanings.definition: Skedded (adjective): arranged or planned in advance
meanings.sent1: The skedded event went smoothly without any hiccups.
meanings.sent2: We had a skedded picnic in the park last Saturday.
meanings.sent3: The skedded surprise party was a huge success.
meanings.sent4: Her skedded vacation was a well-deserved break.
meanings.sent5: The skedded project deadline kept everyone on track.
